verses.verse: A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> or Song <S%H7892><s%> for the sabbath <S%H7676><s%> day. <S%H3117><s%> It is a good <S%H2896><s%> thing to give thanks <S%H3034><s%> unto the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and to sing <S%H2167><s%> praises unto thy name, <S%H8034><s%> O most <S%H5945><s%> High: <S%H5945><s%>
To show <S%H5046><s%> forth your loving kindness <S%H2617><s%> in the morning, <S%H1242><s%> and your faithfulness <S%H530><s%> every night, <S%H3915><s%>
On an instrument of ten <S%H6218><s%> strings, and on the psaltery; <S%H5035><s%> on the harp <S%H3658><s%> with a solemn sound. <S%H1902><s%>
For you, LORD, <S%H3068><s%> have made me glad <S%H8056><s%> through your work: <S%H6467><s%> I will triumph <S%H7442><s%> in the works <S%H4639><s%> of your hands. <S%H3027><s%>
O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> how <S%H4100><s%> great <S%H1431><s%> are your works! <S%H4639><s%> and your thoughts <S%H4284><s%> are very <S%H3966><s%> deep. <S%H6009><s%>
A brutish <S%H1197><s%> man <S%H376><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%> not; neither <S%H3808><s%> does a fool <S%H3684><s%> understand <S%H995><s%> this. <S%H2063><s%>

When the wicked <S%H7563><s%> spring <S%H6524><s%> as the grass, <S%H6212><s%> and when all <S%H3605><s%> the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%> do flourish; <S%H6692><s%> it is that they shall be destroyed <S%H8045><s%> for ever: <S%H5703><s%>
But you, LORD, <S%H3068><s%> are most high <S%H4791><s%> for ever more. <S%H5769><s%>

For, see, <S%H2009><s%> your enemies, <S%H341><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> for, see, <S%H2009><s%> your enemies <S%H341><s%> shall perish; <S%H6><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%> shall be scattered. <S%H6504><s%>
But my horn <S%H7161><s%> shall you exalt <S%H7311><s%> like the horn of an unicorn: <S%H7214><s%> I shall be anointed <S%H1101><s%> with fresh <S%H7488><s%> oil. <S%H8081><s%>

My eye <S%H5869><s%> also shall see <S%H5027><s%> my desire on my enemies, <S%H7790><s%> and my ears <S%H241><s%> shall hear <S%H8085><s%> my desire of the wicked <S%H7489><s%> that rise <S%H6965><s%> up against <S%H5921><s%> me.
The righteous <S%H6662><s%> shall flourish <S%H6524><s%> like the palm <S%H8558><s%> tree: he shall grow <S%H7685><s%> like a cedar <S%H730><s%> in Lebanon. <S%H3844><s%>
Those that be planted <S%H8362><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> shall flourish <S%H6524><s%> in the courts <S%H2691><s%> of our God. <S%H430><s%>
They shall still <S%H5750><s%> bring <S%H5107><s%> forth <S%H5107><s%> fruit <S%H5107><s%> in old <S%H7872><s%> age; <S%H7872><s%> they shall be fat <S%H1879><s%> and flourishing; <S%H7488><s%>
To show <S%H5046><s%> that the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is upright: <S%H3477><s%> he is my rock, <S%H6697><s%> and there is no <S%H3808><s%> unrighteousness <S%H5766><s%> in him.
